title: Augusta County: Sarah H. Davison to E. P. Smith, February 3, 1869
summary: Dewey reports that the AMA institutions in Staunton are improving rapidly, proclaiming, "The prejudices which some of the more educated of the colored people have had are gradually wearing away." She also comments on the status of her "Industrial School," presumably a sewing workshop.
keywords: African Americans, Education, Women, Race Relations, Church/Religious Activity, Economy, American Civil War
